Title: FUTA partners Learnpally to drive digital education across Africa
Summary: Federal University of Technology, Akure (FUTA) partners Learnpally to drive digital education across Africa . FUTA has partnered with digital transformation company to drive global digital learning for universities and professionals throughout Africa .

Title: Oyebanji’s wife condemns murder of woman by husband in Ekiti
Summary: Dr Olayemi Oyebanji’s wife condemns murder of woman by husband in Ekiti . Mrs. Modupe Alasin of Efon Alaaye, allegedly murdered by her husband .

Title: LASG begins urban regeneration of Lagos Island
Summary: LASG begins urban regeneration of Lagos Island . Ministry of Physical Planning and Urban Development laid the foundation for the construction of an ultra-modern shopping mall .

Title: New Rivers council boss reaffirms commitment to peace
Summary: Newly sworn-in chairman of Khana Local Government Area in Rivers State, Dr. Bariere Thomas, reaffirms commitment to peace . He emphasised that his administration will prioritise practical governance that directly impacts lives .

Title: Osun traditional, religious leaders tasked to expose abusers of women
Summary: Traditional rulers, community and religious leaders urged to address rising cases of violence against women and girls in Osun State . They were sensitised on how to prevent the scourge of Sexual and Gender-Based Violence .

Title: Arase wasn’t poisoned, says ex-Rep, Agbonayinma
Summary: Hon. Johnson E. Agbonayinma, a former member of the House of Representatives and Commissioner at the Code of Conduct Bureau, has stated as false reports that former IGP Solomon Arase, who died earlier in the week, was poisoned .

Title: Top 10 countries with the most FIFA World Cup appearances
Summary: Only a handful of countries have managed to qualify regularly for the World Cup . The FIFA World Cup is the biggest stage in football, and only a few countries have qualified regularly .

Title: Bello Shagari urges calm, unity amid rising insecurity in Shagari LGA
Summary: Bello Shagari appeals for calm and unity amid rising insecurity concerns . Community leader and youth activist, popularly known as Yariman, has appealed for calm . Concerns grow over rising insecurity in Shagri Local Government Area of Sokoto State .

Title: White House quietly drops WTO, ILO from foreign aid cut list
Summary: White House quietly drops WTO, ILO from foreign aid cut list . The list originally included $107 million in cuts to ILO funding and another $29 million in slashed funding to the WTO .

Title: Why Nigeria’s resources don’t go round – Osinbajo
Summary: Prof. Yemi Osinbajo, SAN, has given the reasons why the nation's resources are stacked in the hands of a few citizens . He said those entrusted with distribution are bereft of godliness to do the needful . . As Okonkwo, Nwachukwu call for stock taking .

Title: White House quietly drops WTO, ILO from foreign aid cut list
Summary: US President Donald Trump’s Republican administration announced last Friday that it was cancelling $4.9 billion of congressionally approved foreign aid . The list originally included $107 million in cuts to ILO funding and another $29 million in slashed funding to the WTO . But by Wednesday, the WTO had disappeared from the list,

Title: IG appoints Hundeyin new Force PRO
Summary: Inspector-General of Police, Kayode Adeolu Egbetokun, has approved the appointment of CSP Benjamin Hundeyin as the new Force Public Relations Officer . This was according to a statement by the outgoing FPRO, Olumuyiwa Adejobi, on Thursday .

Title: End South-East killings, Amnesty urges FG
Summary: Amnesty International has called on the Federal Government to end the recurring killings in the South-East region of the country . The human rights group had accused Nigerian authorities of enabling a “free-for-all reign of impunity” in the region, where “numerous state and non-state actors have committed serious human rights violations

Title: Tinubu committed to improving roads to boost economy — APC lawmaker
Summary: Engr Aderemi Oseni said President Bola Tinubu is committed to ensuring effective transportation aided by motorable roads all over the country . The lawmaker pledged that the All Progressives Congress in the Southwest will deliver nothing less than 10million votes for the re-election of the President in 2027 .

Title: Soldiers kill bandit, recover AK-47 in Kwara ambush
Summary: Troops of the Nigerian Army have neutralised a suspected bandit and recovered an AK-47 rifle with ammunition during an ambush in the Edu Local Government Area of Kwara State . The operation was carried out by soldiers of the 22 Armoured Brigade stationed at the Forward Operating Base in Patigi, following intelligence on the movement of armed bandits
